section.section: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, any savings bank may be reorganized in order to become a mutual holding company by submitting to the Commissioner an application for approval of reorganization.
A reorganization submitted for approval shall have been approved by the savings bank under the procedures described in § 4-701(c) of this title.

text.section:
The plan of reorganization:
May contain any other provision not inconsistent with law; and
Shall set forth the necessary corporate steps for the savings bank to reorganize into a mutual holding company, including:
All required charter amendments; and
A description of the corporate management of the reorganized mutual holding company.

section.section: Except as provided in subsection (f) of this section, the Commissioner shall publish a notice of filing of the application for approval of the plan of reorganization.
The notice of filing of application shall be published in the Maryland Register as provided in the State Documents Laws.

text.section:
Subject to confirmation by the Secretary of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation, the Commissioner may approve an application without publication of the notice of filing of application in the Maryland Register if:
The financial condition or stability of one of the parties to the proposed reorganization is such that a delay of the proposed reorganization will cause an economic hardship to the party; and
Approval of the application is in the public interest.
